moves.3. b3 Nf6 4. Bb2: White usually responds with d3 or Nc3 here--something to protect the e4 pawn.  But the counterattack works for me.
moves.4... Bc5 5. Bc4 d5 6. Bxd5 Nxd5 7. exd5: Oh, I like Qe2 much better.  If black trades queens, fine--castling is not nearly as important when the queens are gone.
moves.9... Qd3+ 10. Kg1 Bg4 11. h3 Bxf3 12. gx: Mm, I kind of like Qg4+, which gives up black's f4 pawn to the white queen.
moves.14... Nd4 15. Qg4+ Ne6 16. Rd1 f3 17. Nb: That knight was protecting Rd1 and preventing Qe2.  At b5 it doesn't have as much strategic value.  White might be looking at BxPg7, but that is a poisoned pawn.
Mm, I like QxPf7 better.  That sets up QxPc7#.  Black's defensive moves leave the black bishop vulnerable.
